911705737142906880.text: I received the news, of ITLOS' unanimous judgment in favour of Ghana, with great joy. See my full statement here: https://t.co/rM5InykCIl

907539513915920385.text: No meaningful attainment of sustainable world dev't can be achieved without equal participation of women in all segments of human endeavour.

907539405388353537.text: Empowerment of women is not a privilege. It is a right.

907539288698519553.text: Ethiopia- 75% of labour on coffee farms women but earn only 34% of the income.

907539264803663872.text: E.g. Cote D’Ivoire- 60% of labour on cocoa farms women but earn only 21% of the income.

907538751995465728.text: Distribution of income in the agricultural value chain in many cases is tilted against women.

907538455315578881.text: Most land holding systems are male dominated. Women also have limited access to technology for modernized agriculture.

907538435006660608.text: Africa’s land tenure systems make it difficult for women to access and own land for agricultural purposes.

907538339573780480.text: At the last @AfDB_Group Board meeting in India, we concluded that to attract the interest of the youth, agriculture must be cool or sexy

907538158912458752.text: To achieve this not only women but also the youth must be attracted to invest and participate in agricultural production.

907538076544782336.text: The available arable land means Africa has the potential to, not only feed itself but, feed the rest of the world.

907538016578805760.text: Africa possesses about 600 million hectares of uncultivated arable land, amounting to about 60% of the world total.

907537825591164928.text: It is more predominant in certain aspects along the agricultural value chain, e.g. processing and marketing.

907537755672076288.text: Participation of women in agricultural production in Africa is between 40% and 60%.

907537569004572672.text: This Summit appropriately focuses on Women, Agriculture & sustainable development. In no sector is the participation of women more critical

907537298736271361.text: Women must have the right & control to decide the number of children they want, & unfettered access to birth control methods & facilities

907537094406492160.text: The practice of taking young girls out of school midstream and marrying them off mostly to men far older than them must stop.

907537063767093248.text: Girls must not only be made to go to school, but must also stay in school for as far as their capacity for academic pursuit can take them.

907536895642664961.text: One of the most backward & unacceptable practices is child marriage. This must be a cause that we take up with passion.

907536701886746624.text: An our girls are continuing in school to secondary and tertiary levels.

907536614523654144.text: In Ghana, we've achieved the target of gender parity in school enrolment. As many girls as boys are enrolling in school.

907536288710086656.text: Global targeting in the MDGs & SDGs have advanced further the creation of an environment to empower women. #BelieveinAfrica

584328966477066240.text: I conveyed sincere condolences of the Government and people of Ghana to the victims (and their families) of the Garissa University attack.

584326533902401536.text: I have called President Uhuru Kenyatta and expressed our extreme abhorrence of the terrorist attack on Garissa University.

583132992316563456.text: I have called President-elect Buhari to congratulate him and also called President Goodluck Jonathan to commend him for his statesmanship.

573805116769370112.text: The time has come for a collective push to quicken our march towards socio-economic transformation.

573804519378796545.text: Ghana's future depends on you. I am confident that you will rise to the challenge.

573803551576690688.text: We cannot sacrifice our Ghanaian character of ethnic and religious harmony on the alter of political bigotry.

573803038097408000.text: Belonging to different political organisations is no reason why we cannot work together to achieve solutions to our common challenges.

573802739081342976.text: Multi-party democracy is not synonymous with enmity and division.

573801811821391872.text: Ghana is an oasis of peace, democracy, religious and ethnic tranquility.

573801758981558273.text: Our nation is celebrated for our strong democracy, respect for human rights, free expression, ethnic harmony and religious tolerance.

573801736718192640.text: Government is not averse to the use of inter-faith channels and dialogue to resolve any disagreements amongst our different faith groups.

573801691084099587.text: Our diversity must be a source of strength, not a weakness. Our diversity should be harnessed for the realization of our national interest.

573801644921614337.text: Each and everyone of us, in our ethnic and cultural diversity, contributes in a unique way to make our nation great and strong.

573801589561016320.text: We must celebrate and enhance our successes and recognise and minimize our failures.

573801529800593408.text: My heart was gladdened when I noticed the unanimity exhibited in the demonstration in support of equal citizenship.

573801214099521536.text: Happening now: President John Dramani Mahama begins Independence Day address.

573780370883215360.text: I am joined by former Presidents JJ #Rawlings and John Agyekum #Kufuor at the 58th Independence Day parade. #ForwardTogether

573766956786040832.text: President John Dramani Mahama arrives at the #BlackStar Square #Accra for 58th Independence Day parade.

573740704222027776.text: Happy Independence Day. God Bless Our Homeland Ghana.

570930973002502144.text: President John Dramani Mahama exchanges pleasantries with the Minority in Parliament as he exits the chamber of Parliament after #SONAGH2015

570929091576270848.text: We must reject any attempt to sow any strife and discord among us.

570928923908956160.text: Destiny brought us together as one nation. Our ethnic and cultural diversity is a source of strength not a weakness.

570928673542565888.text: I urge families and educational institutions to continue to inculcate a sense of unity, patriotism and nationalism in our people.

570928542155984896.text: We owe it to our forebears, once again, to keep the unity and cohesion of our country. Together we will build a strong and prosperous Ghana.

570927561376702464.text: Our history is replete with glorious tales of remarkable victories and successes. These must spur us on to achieve even far more.

570927302902714369.text: The greatest impediments in the way of patriotism and collective nation building however are unbridled cynicism and excessive partisanship.

570927047956156416.text: Today Ghanaians are more likely to receive better healthcare services than ever before because of significant investment and work done.

570926822822678529.text: More girls are being kept in the classrooms. More women are holding responsible and sensitive positions in our country.

570926730057265152.text: Today there are more of our children enrolled in school than ever before as a direct result of unprecedented opportunities.

570926418726666240.text: Our quest to build a prosperous, inclusive, free and just society is very much on course in spite of the temporary setbacks of electricity.

570925813157081088.text: We have at many points in our history emerged stronger from adversity. We are now an established and respected democracy.

570925316668985347.text: Under our Constitution, it is wrong to prevent Muslim women from wearing the ‘hijab’ or Nuns from wearing their habits to work or to school.

570924700987207680.text: Our constitution in Article 21, Clause 1, guarantees the freedom of religion and the freedom to manifest one’s religious beliefs.

570924384761843712.text: I wish to commend the Service Commanders, Officers and Men of the Armed Forces for their valour and dedication to duty.

570924135972532224.text: Safety and security are key planks in my agenda for transformation and will continue to receive my utmost attention.

570923762255839232.text: We will continue the programme of retooling and reequipping the armed forces with the appropriate instruments and platforms.

570923629371899905.text: The E-Zwich will help to eliminate ghosts in the NSS pay-roll. Government has through this already saved an estimated GHC26.5 million.

570922171066937345.text: We have put in place a new electronic payroll for all National Service Personnel enabling their payments to be loaded on their E-Zwich cards

570921213838675968.text: Our efforts at exposing corruption may result in an erroneous belief that the practice is more pervasive now than before.

570920643031658496.text: We remain committed to a free and independent Judiciary and we continue to support measures aimed at ensuring efficient admin. of justice

570920224071012352.text: I congratulate Parliament for the manner you went about your work and for your collaboration with the executive in exercising oversight.

570919771933425665.text: Let me on behalf of the people of Ghana express our respect for the dedication to work shown by Dr. Afari Djan.

570919494174044160.text: President John Dramani Mahama describes Electoral Commission chairman due for compulsory retirement soon as an 'illustrious son'.#SONAGH2015

570918576074452992.text: I have remained resolute to the key principles of good governance as enshrined in our Constitution because it is the right thing to do.

570918440296423424.text: We have a vibrant civil society and media, which operate in a very free and open environment.

570918327171866625.text: Ghana ranks high in all major governance indicators, human rights, transparency and rule of law assessments.

570918129599168513.text: Good governance, transparency and the fight against corruption form an integral part of the Agenda for Transformation.

570917660730494976.text: Ms Farida Bedwei’s service to the nation on the Board of the National Communications Authority serves as encouragement to many girls.

570914106150129664.text: We're working on many road projects to open up the country to reduce road traffic accidents and bring foodstuffs to the market centres.

570913629882720257.text: Happening now: President John Dramani Mahama's State of the Nation Address to Parliament is streaming live at http://t.co/vVhUu3jHjz

570912739184537600.text: Under the Cocoa Roads Project, a number of feeder, urban and highway roads are earmarked for construction.

570911461679218688.text: I recently commissioned Kpong Water Expansion Project and opened the valve to commence the flow of 20 million gallons of water to households

570911035437289472.text: At the end of this year, we will be covering 76% of the entire country, both rural and urban areas, with good drinking water.

570910810740039680.text: We've over the last two years reversed significantly hardship many of our women and children go through in their search for water.

570910351845416960.text: While we continue to build more hospitals and schools, other critical sectors such as water and ICT sectors continue to engage our attention

570909530416156675.text: Work on the Ho Central Market is ongoing and construction of the new Kumasi Central Market will begin soon

570909238983331840.text: The producer price of cocoa has gone up by 62.74%, that is GH¢3,392.00 per tonne to GHC 5,520 per tonne.

570908221952667648.text: I have asked MASLOC to put together a revolving fund for the benefit our fishmongers along the fishing communities.

570907480869482496.text: I wish to assure all pensioners of the safety of, and better investment returns on, their pension funds.

570906266488463360.text: I wish to express the nation’s gratitude to all those who made the Senchi  Economic Forum possible.

570905564802363392.text: Notwithstanding the recent macroeconomic challenges, investor confidence in Ghana continues to grow as a result of measures we introduced.

570900978561622016.text: Over ten thousand senior citizens are being provided free NHIS subscription in the Greater Accra, Central and Eastern regions.

570900531302043649.text: This year, we shall commence the construction of 15 polyclinics, 10 in the Central Region.

570900370492395520.text: We have also completed and commissioned for use, three district hospitals in Edjumako, Essam and Zabzugu, and 19 Health Centres.

570900225944096768.text: Work is at various stages of completion on 13 district hospitals to bring health services closer to our people.

570900068468953088.text: There are several major hospital projects which when completed will collectively deliver approximately 6,000 new hospital beds.

570899767603167232.text: Government has pumped billions of Cedis into the provision of modern hospitals and the upgrading of facilities.

570899284972965888.text: Our policy thrust at the tertiary education level remains the maintenance of high standards, achieving equity and ensuring relevance.

570898739986100224.text: In fulfillment of my vision to expand access to quality education, construction work is ongoing on the initial 73 Community Day SHS.

570898310262882305.text: Over 1000 projects, ranging from dormitories, classrooms, dining halls, auditoriums and admin blocks have been executed in secondary schools

570897559109173248.text: As a nation we must and we are creating the necessary opportunities for all children of school going age to have access to quality education

570896835184865280.text: Follow President John Dramani Mahama's State of the Nation Address #SONAGH2015 live on http://t.co/vVhUu3jHjz

570896477649838081.text: We have for the first time, introduced a re-sit policy at the basic education level for unsuccessful BECE candidates.

570895950778118144.text: Through improvements in infrastructure and quality of teaching, quality and access to basic education is being enhanced.

570895484744814593.text: While we work on the generation side we must also look at the issue of power conservation.

570895214547734528.text: We are working on a proposal that would make solar power available to barbers, hairdressers, dressmakers and other such micro entrepreneurs

570894902160195584.text: We would be rolling out this year, new initiatives on solar energy.

570894003970945024.text: The new Ministry of power is working on proposals to restructure the power sector beginning with the VRA and the Bui Power Authority.

570892994922094592.text: We have climbed many hills together and we shall conquer many more in our journey of progress.

570892033533083648.text: We've gone through many challenges as a nation but our defining spirit as Ghanaians is that we've picked ourselves up each time we've fallen

570891660214853632.text: I do not intend to manage our energy challenges. I, John Dramani Mahama, as President will fix it.

570891077806387200.text: I also express my endless thanks to the people of Ghana for giving me the opportunity to serve. This is a sacred honour and trust.
